importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The article was published on October 17, 2025, indicating a recent resurgence of military jacket fashion in the context of celebrity culture and global fashion trends.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The 1960s to early 2000s saw a cultural revival of military jackets, particularly among musicians, as a form of anti-establishment expression, influencing modern fashion trends.

keyTakeAways: The military jacket, specifically the Hussar pelisse, is experiencing a major fashion resurgence.
Celebrities such as Jodie Turner-Smith, Zendaya, Jenna Ortega, and Jimi Hendrix have popularized the style in recent appearances.
The trend has historical roots in 18th-century military uniforms, but was significantly reinterpreted by artists and musicians in the 1960s and 1970s.
The style was popularized in mainstream fashion by musicians like Michael Jackson, Beyoncé, and Rihanna, and further cemented by Kate Moss at Glastonbury in 2005.
Luxury fashion houses like Saint Laurent, Balmain, Gucci, and Marc Jacobs have contributed to the trend through stylized reinterpretations.
The Beatles' use of military coats on the cover of 'Sergeant Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band' (1967) symbolized anti-establishment and anti-war sentiments.
In 2025, the Hussar jacket is making a comeback on catwalks, including in collections by Dior, McQueen, Vaquera, and Ann Demeulemeester.
Global searches for 'Hussar jacket' have increased by 300% in October 2025 compared to the previous month, indicating widespread public interest.

namedEntities.name: Jodie Turner-Smith
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is cited as a key figure who popularized the military jacket at the Victoria’s Secret after-party in New York, demonstrating its appeal among high-profile fashion events.

namedEntities.name: Zendaya
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She was spotted wearing a military-style dress-coat at the Louis Vuitton show, linking the trend to modern fashion and historical references to King Louis XVI.

namedEntities.name: Jenna Ortega
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She wore a gothic black Hussar vest at Dior, showcasing the trend in a contemporary, stylized fashion context.

namedEntities.name: Jimi Hendrix
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: American musician and former US Army enlisted soldier
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is cited as a pioneer who subverted the military jacket’s traditional military meaning by wearing it in a bohemian, artistic way in the 1960s, influencing future fashion interpretations.

namedEntities.name: The Beatles
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Their use of military coats on the cover of 'Sergeant Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band' (1967) established the jacket as a symbol of anti-establishment and anti-war sentiment in fashion.

namedEntities.name: Kate Moss
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She helped mainstream the trend by wearing an ivory Hussar jacket to the Glastonbury music festival in 2005.

namedEntities.name: Keburia
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The brand is identified as the source of Jodie Turner-Smith’s Hussar coat, linking the fashion trend to a contemporary, modern designer origin.

namedEntities.name: Saint Laurent
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The brand contributed to the trend through stylized interpretations of the Hussar jacket in the early 2000s.

namedEntities.name: Balmain
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The brand participated in the revival of military jackets through fashion reinterpretations in the early 2000s.

namedEntities.name: Gucci
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The brand contributed to the trend with stylized military jacket designs in the early 2000s.

namedEntities.name: Marc Jacobs
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: In 2002, Marc Jacobs presented a cream wool Hussar jacket with red trim and gold stitching, echoing the Hendrix style.

namedEntities.name: Dior
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Jonathan Anderson’s debut menswear collection for Dior featured the Hussar jacket, signaling its return to high fashion catwalks.

namedEntities.name: McQueen
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The brand has included the Hussar jacket in recent collections, contributing to the modern revival of the style.

namedEntities.name: Vaquera
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The brand has featured the Hussar jacket in recent collections, supporting its resurgence in high fashion.

namedEntities.name: Ann Demeulemeester
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The brand has included the Hussar jacket in recent collections, contributing to the modern revival of the style.

namedEntities.name: Molly Rooyakkers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She provides data on the spike in global searches for 'Hussar jacket,' indicating growing public interest in the fashion trend.

namedEntities.name: Victoria’s Secret
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The brand's after-party in New York provided a key setting where Jodie Turner-Smith wore the jacket, linking it to a major fashion event.

namedEntities.name: Louis Vuitton
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The brand's show at the Louvre where Zendaya appeared provided a high-profile context for the military jacket trend.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The military jacket, particularly the Hussar pelisse, is experiencing a major fashion resurgence in 2025, inspired by celebrity appearances such as Jodie Turner-Smith, Zendaya, and Jenna Ortega. Historically linked to 18th-century military uniforms, the style was reinterpreted by musicians like Jimi Hendrix and The Beatles in the 1960s as a symbol of anti-establishment and artistic rebellion. In the 2000s, it became a staple in pop culture, popularized by artists like Michael Jackson, Beyoncé, and Rihanna, and further mainstreamed by Kate Moss at Glastonbury. Today, luxury fashion houses including Dior, McQueen, Vaquera, and Ann Demeulemeester are featuring the jacket in their collections, and global searches for 'Hussar jacket' have surged by 300% in October 2025, reflecting its growing popularity across the fashion world.
title: Look of the Week: From Jimi Hendrix to Jodie Turner-Smith, why fashion loves a military jacket
